content:
Q: Will I be covered if I am going overseas to receive medical treatment?
A: No. The travel insurance plan does not cover you if you are travelling contrary to the advice of any Qualified Medical Practitioner or for the purpose of obtaining medical treatment.
questions: Does the travel insurance plan cover medical treatment abroad?
Am I covered by travel insurance if I travel for medical reasons?
What are the exclusions of the travel insurance plan regarding medical treatment?
Is overseas medical treatment covered under travel insurance?
Can I use my travel insurance if I am traveling against a doctor's advice?
What happens if I travel for medical treatment under my travel insurance plan?
Are there any conditions under which travel insurance does not provide coverage?
Does travel insurance cover trips made for the purpose of obtaining medical treatment?
What does the travel insurance plan say about traveling on a doctor's advice?
If I ignore medical advice and travel, will my travel insurance still cover me?
